items.title: Gold Coast couple accused of breaching freezing orders a second time amid alleged NDIS fraud investigation
items.summary: It is the second time ASIC has accused David McWilliams and his wife, Laura Fullarton, of breaching freezing orders while the watchdog investigates allegations of NDIS-related fraud.

items.title: Health, environment departments questioned 'evidence' cited in salmon antibiotic approval for florfenicol in Tasmanian waterways
items.summary: Tasmania's health department and environment watchdog questioned the scientific rigour behind an application to use the antibiotic florfenicol in salmon farms, including a lack of evidence about its impact on humans, documents show.

items.title: Funding axe looms for nine childcare centres failing standards
items.summary: Nine childcare services that have failed to lift standards will only be named if the federal government decides to cut their taxpayer funding.

items.summary: Ash Gardner says mastering a simple game plan was the key to Australia's convincing six-wicket win over India in the ODI series opener Brisbane.

items.title: Abattoir Beaufort River Meats halts operations as $20m in live export transition grants are rolled out
items.summary: Forty farming families and five processors have secured live sheep transition funding from more than 260 applicants, including Beaufort River Meats in the Great Southern, which has temporarily shut down amid ongoing livestock shortages.

items.summary: WA Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas apologises to a Labor backbencher who says she felt "intimidated" by him when he stood over her in parliament on Wednesday afternoon.
